alert.note: Alert for Delano-Wasco-Shafter; Southeast San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 2:50PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kern County through 330 PM PDT... At 249 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McFarland, or 9 miles southeast of Delano, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Delano, McFarland and Famoso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
